articles.title: Important Day of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Egypt 
   Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il's celebrated work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" was printed in pamphlet in Egypt on Jan. 30.
 The work, published on June 19, Juche 84 (1995), clarifies the idea that top priority should be given to the ideological work in all matters to successfully accomplish the socialist cause and the idea that main task of the ideological work is to imbue the whole society with the socialist idea and this work should be done in principles and method suited to the intrinsic demands of socialism.

"International Kim Il Sung Prize" Awarded to Kim Jong Il
   New Delhi, February 2 (KCNA) -- The International Kim Il Sung Prize Council announced in New Delhi on February 1 its decision on awarding the "International Kim Il Sung Prize" to Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday.
 According to it, the council decided to confer the prize on General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday in high recognition of his immortal contribution to the noble cause for global peace and security and the independent development of humankind.

articles.content:
Greetings to Sri Lankan President
   Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Mahinda Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka, on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of its independence.
 In the message Kim wished the president success in his work for political stability and economic development of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop on good terms.

articles.title: Homage to Kim Il Sung Paid
Day of Sun and February 16 to Be Commemorated in Tunisia
articles.content:
Homage to Kim Il Sung Paid
   Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The participants in the meeting of front-runners of the Songun revolution visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday to pay respects to President Kim Il Sung.
 They made deep bows to the President who lies in state there, with the irresistible yearning and boundless reverence for him.    
 With deep emotion, they went round the Mourning Hall and a train and a car he used.

articles.title: Works of Peerless Great Men Disseminated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Sun and February 16 to Be Commemorated in Tunisia
   Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Tunisian preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was inaugurated in Tunis on Jan. 27.
 Mustapha Fersy, chairman of the Tunisia-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to set a commemoration period from Feb. 1 to April 30 during which it will hold various events.

articles.content:
Maltese Preparatory Committee Formed to Celebrate February 16
   Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Maltese preparatory committee for celebrating February 16 was inaugurated in Valetta on Jan. 29.
 The international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Malta was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold various events on the occasion of the February holiday.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Gag on Press under Fire
Moves for Revival of Fascist Dictatorship Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Gag on Press under Fire
   Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Internet Journalists Association and other press organizations, the Council of Human Rights Organizations and the People's Solidarity for the Abolition of the "security law" in south Korea reportedly issued a joint statement on Jan. 29 to denounce the police's suppression of Ri Si U, a mediaperson who has devoted himself to dealing with matters related to the U.S. troops and the "UN Command" in south Korea.
 The statement recalled that through a document obtained in the U.S., Ri exposed the fact that depleted uranium shells are kept in the U.S. military bases in south Korea and has written articles contributing to peace, positively acting as a mediaman.    
 The police's crackdown on him cannot be interpreted otherwise than an intention to put a gag on the specialist as the issue of dissolving the "UN Command" was raised recently, the statement said, holding that the SL, which encourages such anachronistic repressive moves as wanton violation of freedom of speech, should be scrapped at once.

articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Kyrgyzstan
   Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Agim Isabekov on his appointment as Prime Minister of Kyrgyzstan.
 Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on better terms in mutual interests, the message wished him success in his responsible work for prosperity of Kyrgyzstan.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
Japan's Crackdown on Chongryon Assailed
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
   Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Mexico in a statement on Jan. 29 strongly denounced the Japanese authorities' recently intensified suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) at the U.S. back and call as a wanton violation of human rights and international law.
 Saying that the suppression is intended to stamp out Chongryon, the statement demanded an immediate stop to it.    
 It expressed full support to the Koreans in Japan struggling to defend their rights to independence and existence.
